title: What would be an example of a useless text message? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, I can tell you a story about this. A few weeks ago, I was late to Farmers' Market. As I parked my car, I received a text message. I took my eggs out of the car and was walking toward the building when I thought to look at it. The text was from the guy who runs the market, and it said, "Are you close?" I stopped walking and from the sidewalk in front of the building, sent a reply: "You might say that." I saw the message had been sent, so I put my phone back in my pocket, and went inside. The guy was in the middle of reading my text when I walked in: he looked up and said, "You sent this from the parking lot!" I said, "Technically, it was the sidewalk."

“k” Nothing is as maddening as sending a text which is looking for an answer, with some detail and/or insight, and getting back “k”. This person literally couldn’t even be bothered to give the courtesy of the second letter by typing “ok”, never mind anything else. They might just as well have left you on read. So yeah, that’s about as useless as text messages get.
What are you doing? Are you ready? Are you coming? Is this who I think it is? Can I call you?
